meanings.definition: A type of brightly colored Ghanaian cloth made of silk and cotton.
meanings.sent1: I wore a beautiful kente dress to the celebration.
meanings.sent2: The kente fabric was carefully woven by hand.
meanings.sent3: The kente cloth danced in the wind as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as vibrant as a piece of kente.
meanings.sent5: The kente cloth shimmered under the bright sun.

meanings.definition: To weave or create fabric in the style of kente.
meanings.sent1: She learned how to kente the threads together.
meanings.sent2: The artisans kente the intricate patterns with skill.
meanings.sent3: I tried to kente my hair into a fancy braid.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to kente a beautiful story.
meanings.sent5: The music kented a joyful melody in the air.

meanings.definition: A traditional Ghanaian garment made from kente cloth.
meanings.sent1: The elders wore their kente proudly during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate details of the kente garment.
meanings.sent3: The kente outfit made him feel like a king for the day.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as bright as the colors of the kente.
meanings.sent5: The kente attire symbolized unity and heritage.
